intro: Hedyotis tetrangularis, commonly known as the four-angled hedyotis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite, four-angled leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
